Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.executor

Interface TaskExecutor<LOCAL>

  • Type Parameters:
    LOCAL - object/state local to each thread, that submitted tasks can get access to when running.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Panicable, Parallelizable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DynamicTaskExecutor
    public interface TaskExecutor<LOCAL>
extends Parallelizable, AutoCloseable, Panicable
    Like an ExecutorService with additional absolute control of the current processor count, i.e. the number of threads executing the tasks in parallel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void assertHealthy()
      Asserts that this TaskExecutor is healthy.
      void close()
      Closes this TaskExecutor, disallowing new tasks to be submitted.
      void submit​(Task<LOCAL> task)
      Submits a task to be executed by one of the processors in this TaskExecutor.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.staging.Panicable

        receivePanic

      • Methods inherited from interface org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.Parallelizable

        processors

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        void submit​(Task<LOCAL> task)
        Submits a task to be executed by one of the processors in this TaskExecutor. Tasks will be executed in the order of which they arrive.
        Parameters:
        task - a Runnable defining the task to be executed.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this TaskExecutor, disallowing new tasks to be submitted.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • assertHealthy

        void assertHealthy()
        Asserts that this TaskExecutor is healthy. Useful to call when deciding to wait on a condition this executor is expected to fulfill.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - of some sort if this executor is in a bad stage, the original error that made this executor fail.
